result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Kratwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed;
Good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Kratwell

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:43 am 
INCLUDES 22CF305 & 22CM61. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Jessica Phelps. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State to e-file information in 22CF305. 
State moves to: 
In 22CM61: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 22CF305: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to 24 days credit if revoked. 
Adj: 10:50 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Atty Jessica Phelps
Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Speedy Trial Demand, And Motion To Withdraw Motion For Bond Modification
Calendar call on May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
